articles.title: Microsoft Inks Deal With NVIDIA-Backed CoreWeave
articles.summary: Microsoft has signed a deal with NVIDIA-backed cloud-computing startup CoreWeave, planning to invest billions to bolster its cloud computing infrastructure for AI operations. This partnership will provide Microsoft easier access to NVIDIA’s GPUs, which are crucial for AI-based applications like ChatGPT, and aims to give Microsoft a competitive edge against rivals like Alphabet Inc. and Amazon Web Services. CoreWeave’s access to over 45,000 GPUs and its status as an elite CSP in the NVIDIA Partner Network positions it as a key enabler for Microsoft's AI endeavors.

articles.title: High Beta ETF 'SPHB' Lifted by Heavy Tech Sector Tilt
articles.summary: The Invesco S&P 500 High Beta ETF (SPHB) performed strongly in May, driven by its significant allocation to the information technology sector. While the broader S&P 500 saw modest gains, the S&P 500 High Beta index climbed 2.4% due to the tech sector's 9.5% rally. SPHB has also demonstrated strong long-term performance, outpacing the S&P 500 over a three-year period.

articles.title: A.I. ETF Sold Out Of Monster Energy, Three Ways To Look At It
articles.summary: The Artificial Intelligence driven ETF (AMOM) unexpectedly sold its entire position in Monster Beverage (MNST), despite Monster's strong performance and growth. The article explores three perspectives on this move, comparing Monster's valuation and performance against Starbucks (SBUX), PepsiCo (PEP), and Coca-Cola (KO), highlighting Monster's aggressive growth trajectory versus the more predictable cash flows and dividends of its peers. The analysis suggests Monster still has significant room for outperformance.

articles.title: CoreWeave Secures $200 Million Series B Extension, Bringing Total Round to $421 Million
articles.summary: CoreWeave, a specialized cloud provider, announced an additional $200 million in Series B funding from Magnetar Capital, bringing its total Series B round to $421 million. This extension comes just one month after their initial $221 million Series B funding, highlighting the accelerated demand for their specialized cloud infrastructure due to the boom in generative AI technology. CoreWeave's focus on GPU-accelerated workloads offers faster and more cost-effective solutions for compute-intensive tasks compared to larger, generalized cloud providers.

articles.title: BlackRock’s $9 Billion Quant ETF Set to Lean in on Nvidia, Tech
articles.summary: BlackRock’s iShares MSCI USA Momentum Factor ETF (MTUM), a $9 billion fund, is expected to significantly increase its exposure to technology stocks, including Nvidia. This rebalancing will raise the fund's allocation in information technology to 21% from 3%, shifting away from sectors like health care and energy. This move is driven by the recent equity rally in large technology companies and is anticipated to make the ETF pricier and more volatile.

articles.title: NVIDIA Collaborates With Microsoft to Accelerate Enterprise-Ready Generative AI
articles.summary: NVIDIA announced the integration of its NVIDIA AI Enterprise software with Microsoft Azure Machine Learning to provide an end-to-end cloud platform for enterprise-ready generative AI. This collaboration offers Azure customers tools to build, deploy, and manage customized AI applications using over 100 NVIDIA AI frameworks, enhancing development speed and security for large language models. The integration leverages high-performance NVIDIA accelerated computing for AI model training and inference and also makes NVIDIA Omniverse Cloud available on Microsoft Azure.

articles.title: Fidelity Metaverse ETF ETF Price, Holdings, & News (NASDAQ:FMET)
articles.summary: This article provides an overview of the Fidelity Metaverse ETF (FMET), including its price, holdings, and recent news. FMET tracks a market cap-weighted index of equities related to the metaverse, launched on April 19, 2022, and is managed by Fidelity. The ETF has seen a significant increase in share price since the beginning of 2025 and lists its top institutional shareholders and key holdings.

articles.title: Applied Materials plans to build US$4bn R&D center
articles.summary: Applied Materials plans to invest up to US$4 billion to construct a new Research and Development (R&D) center in Silicon Valley, aiming to accelerate semiconductor manufacturing innovation. This "EPIC Center" would be the largest R&D facility in the semiconductor industry and is envisioned to speed up the transition of academic research to factory production, while also potentially leveraging funding from the US CHIPS and Science Act. The project seeks to address technical challenges and attract talent crucial for the industry's growth.

articles.title: Applied Materials plans $4B Silicon Valley R&D facility
articles.summary: Applied Materials announced plans to invest up to $4 billion in a new Silicon Valley research and development facility. This "EPIC Center" will focus on advancing semiconductor manufacturing and is expected to house over $25 billion in research work within its first decade. The investment is contingent on receiving funding from the CHIPS and Science Act, aiming to accelerate the industry's ability to bring new technologies to market.

articles.title: Chart of the Week: How To Benefit From AI on Advisors' Minds
articles.summary: This article discusses how financial advisors are increasingly interested in artificial intelligence (AI) as an investment theme, surpassing interest in electric vehicles or healthcare technology. It highlights various sectors AI impacts beyond major tech companies and reviews several AI-focused ETFs, including Global X Artificial Intelligence & Technology ETF (AIQ), ROBO Global Artificial Intelligence ETF (THNQ), and WisdomTree Artificial Intelligence and Innovation Fund (WTAI), detailing their holdings, fees, and performance. The article also mentions related ETFs partially connected to AI and robotics and promotes an upcoming webcast on AI investing.

articles.title: For the First Time Ever, Single-Stock ETFs Will Close Soon
articles.summary: Seven single-stock ETFs, primarily offering leveraged or inverse exposure to individual stocks, are set to close in June, marking the first time such products will cease trading. Despite initial high expectations when they launched in July 2022, most single-stock ETFs have struggled, with minimal assets under management for those slated for closure. AXS will close five of its single-stock ETFs tied to companies like Nike, Pfizer, and PayPal, while GraniteShares is closing a Tesla-related fund, and AXS will also close two other leveraged/inverse ETFs targeting China internet and de-SPAC companies.

articles.title: How to Invest in Gaming
articles.summary: The gaming industry, projected to reach US$211.2 billion in revenues by 2025, offers numerous investment opportunities, including mobile and cloud gaming which are experiencing significant growth. Investors can engage through individual stocks of hardware and software companies, or by using exchange-traded funds (ETFs) for broader industry exposure. Esports, particularly, is set for rapid expansion with a compound annual growth rate of 17.8 percent due to increasing smart device adoption and internet connectivity.
